class_notes:
Course Topic: Feminist and Queer Memoir


In this course, we will explore forms and theories of queer and feminist life writing, specifically examining how memoirs continue to play a central role in the development of LGBTQ+ and feminist discourses. We will learn about the history of memoir as a genre, discuss how personal narratives have circulated in the public sphere, and analyze techniques authors use to communicate intersectional identities. Together, we will investigate how life writing has the potential to capture alternative histories and encapsulate distinct subcultures.  
We will read texts from the 1970s and 1980s likes Zami: A New Spelling of My Name by Audre Lorde as well as contemporary works such as Spinning by Tillie Walden. This course is designed to provide opportunities for you to strengthen your skills in critical thinking, close reading, and visual analysis. Assignments include essays, discussion posts, and a final research or creative project of your choosing.
